newsitem.title: MEXICO: Abaco, Principal see fund approval soon.
newsitem.headline: Abaco, Principal see fund approval soon.

text.p: Mexico's Grupo Financiero Abaco and U.S.-based Principal International Inc expect to win approval shortly for their pension fund to operate in Mexico, the companies said on Monday.
Afore Principal Confia, the name of their joint venture, plans to begin competing with other private pension funds in July, when Mexico ends its current public pension system.

"We have been told off the record that everything has gone well, and we are awaiting the official approval at any moment, probably this week," said Gerardo Pelaez, director of marketing for The Principal in Argentina.
He said the group planned to charge a commission of about 12.4 percent per year on the amount of money set aside by each worker.
The Mexican government has so far approved 12 Afores, as the pension fund managers are called. It is due to rule on five more companies, including Principal Confia, by the end of March.
